dialogues.text: You remember Buzz Meeks, Dudley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disgrace as a policeman. Straight D fitness reports from every C.O. he ever served under. What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve years ago he worked a vice roust with Dick Stensland.  They arrested a Pierce Patchett on an extortion scam.  Guy ran hookers. He'd have them photographed with their johns, then double-dip for some blackmail.  Charges got dropped.  Insufficient evidence. You were supervising officer on the case and I was wondering if you remember anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this all about, lad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of it has to do with a murder.  I've been working with Ed Exley on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Narco, lad, not Homicide. And since when do you work with Edmund?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a private investigation.  I fucked something up and I want to make amends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, then...) Don't start trying to do the right thing, John.  You haven't had enough practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley walks over, hands Jack his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you discussed this with anyone else, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even with Exley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shakes his head.  Dudley raises a REVOLVER.  He FIRES it at point-blank range, right into Jack's heart. Jack hits the floor, his cheek pressed flat on the linoleum. Jack opens his mouth to speak.  His lips form the words, but no sound comes out.  Dudley crouches down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you a valediction, lad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley leans low, gives Jack an ear.  As he dies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rollo Tomasi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley frowns in ignorance at the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing mobilizes the police like losing one of their own.  Dudley is at the podium along with Exley.  Dozens of detectives take notes, including Bud White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Vincennes' body was found in Echo Park at ten o'clock this morning.  Killed by a single .38 round to the heart.  One of our own, gentlemen.  We cannot tolerate it.  Justice must be swift and merciless.  That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the men move odd, Dudley approaches Exley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmund, a word with you.  We received a tip this morning.  Did Vincennes ever mention the name Rollo Tomasi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley tries to look like he's thinking as Jack calls from the grave.  Screaming the name Dudley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Where'd the tip come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anonymous.  Probably nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dudley moves off, Exley watches him go.  Scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud looks over as Dudley sits down across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're perplexing to me these days, Wendell.  You're not your old, cruel self anymore.  I need proof that the extracurricular work I had planned for you remains within your grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've long been involved in containing hard crime in such a way that myself and a few colleagues might someday enjoy a profit dispensation.  That day will soon be here and you'll share handsomely.  Grand means will be in our hands, Wendell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine crime limited to the criminal element who perpetrate it. Imagine the means to keep the nigger filth sedated.  But don't stop there.  Extrapolate.  Imagine the police in control.  It's big, lad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost me, Dudley.  I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your extracurricular secrets, I have mine.  We'll hold a clarification session soon.  For now, I need your fearsome old habits at the Victory Motel. We're going to brace a man who may know who killed Jack Vincennes. Can I count on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, boss.  Sure you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinker looks up as Exley enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what you and Jack Vincennes talked about last night. Anything and everything.  Start with the I.D. on the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A put-upon Pinker sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ex-cop.  Buzz Meeks.  I pulled his police academy photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinker goes to his desk for a twenty-year-old photo of Meeks.  he hands it to Exley, whose wheels are turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a dead ex-cop and a girl who looks like Rita Hayworth at the Nite Owl.  Another dead ex-cop under the house of Rita's mother. It's not a good week for ex-cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got Vincennes in the next room. It's not a good week for cops in general.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RAIN STORM has turned the courtyard into a mud bath. As usual, a light burns in room six.  Bud White parks alongside the other cars already here.  He makes a dash for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid Hudgeons is cuffed to the hot seat.  Dudley sits across from him.  Dudley's henchman Breuning looms.  Bud enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mr. Hudgeons, Wendell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy to cooperate.  You don't need to tie me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for your own safety.  Now what can you tell us about Sergeant John Vincennes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trashcan Jack.  The Big V.  I can tell you he's on the Night Train to the big adios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breuning cuffs Hudgeons in the side of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy!  I didn't have anything to do with him getting killed if that's what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were business associates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that have to do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breuning cuffs him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay so we worked together.  It was an information exchange.  I got him first class collars and he got me good stories.  We were friends for Chrissakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  We'll drop that line for now.  Next topic.  Please comment on Pierce Patchett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud looks over at mention of the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he had something to do with Vincennes getting iced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley sighs, looks to Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendell.  I want full and docile cooperation on all topics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgeons flinches as Bud steps up, twice Breuning's size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Okay.  Everyone knows Patchett's worth a boat-load of greenbacks.  From aviation, freeway construction.  But the man has hobbies, too.  He bankrolls B movies under the table and runs movie star look-alike hookers. And try this on:  he's rumored to be a periodic heroin sniffer.  All in all a powerful behind-the- scenes strange-o.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud digs a fist into Hudgeons' gut.  As Hudgeons gasps to get his breath back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reciprocity, Mr. Hudgeons, is the key to all relationships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs call girls.  Primo tail. Fixed up like movie stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud looms, rests his hands on the back of Hudgeons' chair.  He doesn't like where this is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my car.  Blackmail shit.  The trunk under the carpet.  Patchett got me to photograph a cop fucking this gorgeous cunt Lynn, looks just like Veronicaaa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooden slats pop as Bud tears the bolted chair right out of the floor.  Hudgeons and the chair land sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud can't hear him.  He uprights the chair one-handed. As his fist cocks back, he's restrained by Breuning and Dudley.  This is no act.  They can barely hold Bud back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud breaks free, heads outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud jams a tire iron into the trunk seam and pops it with a ferocious yank.  He tears at the carpeting.  A manila envelope.  Bud rips it open and 8x10 glossies of Exley and Lynn spill out.  Raindrops dot them, as Bud's in his Packard and tearing out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley and Breuning watch from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't trade places with Edmund Exley right now for all the tea in China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breuning laughs.  So does Hudgeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley, I thought you were gonna let the dumb bastard kill me. (to Breuning) And you!  Learn to pull those punches a little better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley and Breuning stare at him.  A bit grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can uncuff me now, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But no one moves to do so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas? (nervous) We had a deal.  You, me and Patchett,  We're a team! (scared) Come on, we're friends.  We're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hudgeons protests, Dudley slaps a hand over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush-hush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Breuning and Carlisle move in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wormish CLERK searches dusty filing cabinets with dates like 1939 and 1940.  The same ones Jack looked through. Exley steps over from another row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So on active duty, Meeks didn't make an arrest from 1938 to '43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone must've pulled the records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley ponders the implications.  Taking out the photo of Meeks, he gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the police academy files?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time.  I have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just show me where they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue, Lynn sits on her porch watching the rain come down. A SCREECHING on the wet street as Bud's PACKARD pulls up. She watches as he gets out and starts for the house. Lynn stands, holds her arms out.  Bud stops short on the steps, out of reach, the rain soaking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you talk to Exley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in out of the rain.  In the morning we'll have both our stories for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning flashes.  Bud shakes hs head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know about Exley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the opposite of you.  He's more like me.  Cold, calculating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get to know so much about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More lightning.  Lynn looks God-awful sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in out of the rain, Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tell me what happened with you and Exley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away) In the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Now. (a beat) You fucked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too tired to lie anymore, Lynn finally just nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was helping you.  I thought --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud backhands her, hard.  Lynn faces straight into the next one as Bud hits her again.  A third time as the sins of the father are visited on the son.  Bud stops short as the self-realization slams home.  Lynn waits stoically. She doesn't start crying till Bud turns and runs back into the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drawers are open.  Files are everywhere.  Exley's reached the end of the line.  As he looks through one last file, he finds a stack of official photos.  Then he stops short.  There's a photo of four cadets and an academy instructor. Two of the cadets are IDed as Turner Meeks and Dick Stensland.  The instructor is Dudley Smith! Exley looks up at the sound of FOOTSTEPS and Bud is there.  Fury.  He slams Exley, knocks him flat. Bud's here to kill him.  He hauls Exley up, pummels him, then throws him over the table.  Then up into a wall. Plaster cracks.  Bud's on some gonzo animal plane.  Bud strangles him.  Exley gags.  It'll be over in moments. Until Exley's flailing hands finds Bud's .38.  Yanking it from his waistband, Exley smashes Bud in the forehead. Bud reels.  But, blind with rage, he moves back in only to have the barrel of the .38 placed right between his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud shakes his head.  He's coiled, ready to make a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you?  Did Dudley have anything to do with you finding out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud hesitates, the answer obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.  Dudley killed Jack. It has something to do with Buzz Meeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley points out the academy photo on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  Dudley and Meeks go way back.  Stensland, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud sees, but does he really?  As Bud reaches for the photo, Exley relaxes slightly.  Bud slaps the gun away, drops Exley to the ground.  He grabs, begins slamming his head into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think, goddamn you.  Think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley's almost out.  But maybe Bud heard him.  The attack slows, stops as Bud does think.  Exley stays conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew Stensland and Meeks knew each other.  Meeks was with Sue Lefferts on Christmas Eve.  The night I met Lynn.  Lefferts' mother I.D.ed Stensland as Lefferts' boyfriend, but Stens pretended he didn't know either one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stensland and Meeks.  What were they up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Stompanato told me when Meeks disappeared, he was trying to move the 18 pounds of heroin that went missing when Deuce Perkins was shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stensland and Buzz Meeks.  Two-man triggers knocking off Mickey Cohen lieutenants.  When they killed Deuce Perkins, they got heroin as a bonus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then something goes wrong.  Meeks gets killed.  Maybe Stens got greedy, killed Meeks and left him under his girlfriend's house. (a beat) The night he died, Stens was all mysterious.  Said he had something big going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nite Owl!  Stensland was going there to sell the heroin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody got wind of it, killed them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't the Negroes.  The Griffith Park report was a phony. And, who says the purple Merc was spotted outside the Nite Owl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first guys to the car when Jack and I got there were Bruening and Carlisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley's guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't find the shotguns. They planted them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all keeps coming back to Dudley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dudley for the Nite Owl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just stare at each other a beat as it sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce Patchett figures in, too. That's the angle Jack was working. Dudley must work for Patchett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Jack, for Stensland, for anybody else who got in the way. I've been trying to be smart.  A detective.  But killing those two fuckers, that would be justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay smart, Bud.  We build a case. We play by the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no rules!  Why the fuck are you doing this?  The Nite Owl made you.  You want to tear all that down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a wrecking ball.  You want to help me swing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud smiles.  For a second he likes Exley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go see Pierce Patchett.  Run a good-cop-bad-cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one are you and which one am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley and Bud make their way up the walk.  Bud pulls his .38 from its shoulder holster, shoves it in his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expecting problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patchett uses a lot of ex-cop muscle.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Exley RINGS the BUZZER.  Looking back, Bud sees a pitching wedge and pile of golf balls abandoned in the grass.  A single ball floats in the koi pond.  Bud's eyes narrow at the sight.  Not like Patchett at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bud shoulders the heavy door right off its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud draws his .38 as he strides in.  Exley tries to keep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a screaming whisper) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double doors on the left open into a library.  Bud stops short, slowly lowers his gun.  Exley steps up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARY
dialogues.text: Hanging from a ceiling light, Patchett's body slowly twists around, a toppled chair beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think his ex-cop did him much good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud goes to the body while Exley heads for a side table on which rests a typed sheet of paper. Bud checks Patchett's right hand, the knuckles are split, two of the fingers badly distended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a suicide note.  Says he killed Jack because Jack had figured out a pornography scam Patchett was running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had help getting up there.  Two of his fingers are broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had one thing figured wrong.  I don't think Dudley workd for Patchett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patchett's dead.  He sent you after me.  I'd say Dudley's tying up his loose ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it hits him) Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud dashes to the PHONE, dials.  It RINGS.  No one answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a guy who owes me in the Sheriff's department.  West Hollywood station.  He can be at her house in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud shoves the phone into his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A county sheriff's unmarked parked out front.  A DEPUTY behind the wheel.  Exley's Plymouth pulls up behind.  The Deputy gets out.  MOVE WITH him as he steps BACK TO Exley, who's rolling down his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took her to Hollywood Station for safekeeping.  Someone worked her over pretty good.  She wouldn't say who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley looks at Bud.  Bud looks down in shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold her as Joan Smith.  No one sees her unless I okay it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, Exley.  And now we're even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Deputy moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis Loew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack thought he was up to his neck in all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY looks up as Bud and Exley beeline Loew's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go in there!

dialogues.speaker: INNER OFFICE
dialogues.text: Loew looks up as they burst in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to call the police, Mr. Loew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask for Captain Dudley Smith. We'll have a party.  Hot dogs and sauerkraut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Loew considers his options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  These are police. (as she leaves) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want D.A. bureau men to tail Dudley Smith twenty-four hours a day; I want you to get a judge to authorize a wire tap on his home phone; I want authorization to check his bank records and I want it all in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what evidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.  Call it a hunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Absolutely not.  Dudley Smith is a highly decorated member of this city's police department and I won't smear his name without --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without what, his smearing yours first?  What's he got on you, Loew?  Pictures of you and an out of work actor with your pants down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any proof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The proof had his throat slit. (a beat) So far you're not denying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to dignify youwith answers.  If you'll excuse me, I've got a Jack Vincennes press conference to prepare for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loew enters his bathroom.  Bud looks to Exley who nods: Go.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Loew is at the mirror clipping a few stray nose hairs. Bud enters full of menace followed by Exley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you're here to wipe my ass, I think we're through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud just glares at him.  Loew shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try this good cop/bad cop with me.  I practically invented it.  And so what if some homo actor is dead.  Boys, girls, ten of them step off the bus to L.A. every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MIRROR SPIDERWEBS as Bud slams Loew's face into it. Bud swings him around, forces him forward and shoves his head in the toilet. He holds it there, finally lets Loew up for breath.  Then backhands:  one, two, three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley Smith.  Spill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him off, Exley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More backhands.  Holding Loew by the scruff of the neck, Bud marches him past Exley and back into the...

dialogues.speaker: INNER OFFICE
dialogues.text: Bud heaves up the window, practically throws Loew through it.  Loew catches hold of the window framing.  Bud hammers his hands loose with a fist and pushes him through.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Bud holds his leg.  Loew screams as coins, comb and wallet spill from his pockets, plummet toward the street below.

dialogues.speaker: INNER OFFICE
dialogues.text: Bud shakes Loew, could drop him at any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I let you go, there'll be ten more lawyers to take your place tomorrow.  They just won't come on the bus, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: We hear Loew's PANT LEG TEARING loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  You're right!  Dudley's got photos of me and Reynolds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Dudley's scheme?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More TEARING.  Loew's life may depend on the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley's rotten to the core.  He's taking over Mickey Cohen's rackets, his own hand-picked cops'll be the new franchise holders.  Because of those pictures I won't be able to prosecute.  Oh Jesus pull me up!

dialogues.speaker: INNER OFFICE
dialogues.text: Exley helps pull Loew back inside.  Bud dumps him on the floor.  Bruised and bloodied, Loew looks up at Exley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley's got everyone under his thumb.  Not just me, but the Chief of Police, the lieutenant governor, everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley pulls his .38, shoves it into the side of Loew's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everybody.  You tip-off Dudley and Officer White visits you alone next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loew looks at Bud, nods, his face a bloody mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley and Bud exit.  Bud's wheels are turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never made a match on the shotgun serial numbers.  What if Breuning and Carlisle took them from the evidence room?  Couple of cold pieces that had been hanging around a year or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should check the records, and, we should talk to Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud just stares at him a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud looks away, shakes his head "no."  Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do it.  I'll check the files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn looks up as Exley enters.  her face is puffy, swollen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) If I knew you were coming I'd have baked a cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget everything else for a second, Lynn.  Is there anything you can give me on Dudley Smith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blank look from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police captain.  I think he's behind all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) I work for Patchett.  I had a feeling that there was someone else, but I never knew who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Look, if it helps, Bud hates himself for what he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) I know how he feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Exley wonders how he should interpret this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if it's pathetic or romantic, but when this is all over I'd like to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn looks away, can't help an ironic smile even as she starts to cry.  As Exley gives her his handkerchief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud waits at the cage window as a RECORDER returns with some information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your guns, Bud.  Signed in April 3rd, 1950.  Remember the First Western bank robbery?  They were used in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No can do.  I can't find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bud thinks, a ROOKIE-TYPE approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh -- Sergeant White?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch just got a call for you. Lieutenant Exley wants you to meet him at the Victory Motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's Packard crests the rise looking down on the Victory.  Exley's Plymouth is in the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley in the hotseat.  Sitting there thinking.  At a CAR DOOR CLOSING, he goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley opens the door as Bud approaches, toting a shotgun. The sun is down.  The sky is just a dull glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to meet here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  You called it.  I got a message that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the reality sinks in, Bud and Exley hear TIRES on the GRAVEL; CARS are COMING.  Being in a concavity, they don't see them yet.  Then the CARS STOP.   But still Bud and Exley can't see anything.  They hear the CLICKS of CAR DOORS OPENING, but they don't hear them shut.  There are FOOTSTEPS, MURMURED WHISPERS.  More CARS PULL UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley starts for his car, but Bud holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Resigned, Exley nods.  They retreat back to Room 6, disappear inside.  A beat.  There's MOVEMENT in the shadows to the left.  To the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a big back window.  Bud covers most of it with a ratty old mattress.  He pumps the shotgun. He pulls a .45 automatic from his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the auto to Exley, pulls out a .38.  Bud's armed for bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figured this was a set-up? And you showed up anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of bad stuff happened here. It's as good a place as any for it to end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud switches off the light.  They wait in silence.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, all I ever wanted was to measure up to my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I spent years trying not to live down to mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) We should block off the bathroom. They could come through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CREAK outside the front door.  Bud levels the SHOTGUN. BOOM!  The DOOR is BLOWN OFF ITS HINGES.  We see the figure of a man sprawl back in the dirt.  In the darkness beyond, MUZZLE FLASHES from all around.  Exley and Bud RETURN FIRE. We hear the BACK WINDOW BREAK under a MUFFLED BLOW.  Bud charges back, yanks down the mattress revealing two men climbing through.  Sitting ducks:  torn apart by THREE TRIPLE-AUGHT ROUNDS close in.  A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud smiles, in on the plan as theres an answering WHOOP. A third man looks through the window.  BOOM!  Bud nails him. Bud motions Exley to stay put, then slips out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud crouches, looks between the cinder blocks supporting the room.  Two sets of feet shuffling along.  Bud FIRES the SHOTGUN.  Shrieks as the men go down.  Bud extends the .38 to fire point blank headshots.  Then... Bud flattens himself as a wicked CROSSFIRE TEARS UP ROOM 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley is forced down as well, lying flat as plaster rains down. The door frame splinters as more Dudley men charge in. Four men with rifles.  One is Patchett's Burly Bodyguard. They spot Exley lying there.  Hushed whispers as they approach:  "Dead meat."  "Be careful."  Kicks in the side.  The men look at each other, sneer. Exley jerks a foot.  The foot man stumbles as Exley spins around SHOOTING.  FIRING the .45 and his own .38.  All four men go down.  Exley stands, digs into his pocket to reload. Bud scrambles back through the window.  Exley looks over and smiles as Bud reloads the shotgun.  It's dead quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking we might walk away from this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that instant, Dudley steps through the bathroom door. He's got Exley dead to rights.  As he squeezes the trigger, Bud leaps forward, pushes Exley hard to the ground. The SHOT passes through Bud's back by his left shoulder blade.  It spins him around.  A SECOND SHOT to the stomach slows him to a walk as he charges Dudley.  A THIRD ROUND SHATTERS Bud's jaw, but still he comes. Driven by rage, his hands reaching for Dudley's throat. He even gets hold before a FOURTH SLUG tears his chest. Bud falls hard. Dudley swings his aim to Exley who's just managed to shake the cobwebs of being flattened by Bud.  A frozen moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm loathe to kill my brother officers, Edmund.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that to Jack Vincennes.  To Stensland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack was a shame, but Dick Stensland had the audacity to try to sell me my own heroin.  Through his whore girl friend.  I sent him to make the buy.  The rest is history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vacuum, Edmund.  That's what we have in Los Angeles.  Sending Mickey Cohen up created it.  My containment work maintained it. Certain photographs guarantee it. Organized crime has been held back, but there's still a demand for the services it provides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you'll provide them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  Prostitution and gambling are victimless crimes. The heroin we'll run down to the coloreds.  Anesthetize them.  As long as it's not a middle class problem, no one will care.  It's still a crime free city... for respectable people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley aims the .38, cocks back the hammer.  We hear DISTANT POLICE SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't politics, Edmund. There won't be winners and losers when it's over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley doesn't see Bud stir, reach into a pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the living and the dead. It's always been that way in the Bureau.  You should've realized that before you became a detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.  Dudley's finger tightens on the trigger.  But Dudley screams as Bud buries a switchblade into his left calf.  It took all Bud had left.  As he collapses... Dudley wails; Exley dives for Bud's shotgun.  Dudley FIRES, misses.  A wild SHOTGUN BLAST takes out half the wall.  Dudley stumbles out the door.  SIRENS BLARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudley drops his gun as the cruisers stream down.  Exley steps out behind him, but doesn't drop the shotgun.  The two of them are bleached white by headlights. Dudley raises his badge over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're policemen! (winks) Let me do the talking.  They'll make you Chief of Detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley steps ahead to block his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not, lad?  Absolute justice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Would you be willing to rig crime scene evidence to support a prosecuting attorney's working hypothesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley doesn't answer.  Dudley smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you be willing to beat confessions out of suspects you knew to be guilty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley glares.  Laughing, Dudley brushes by, limps toward the gathering policemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you willing to shoot hardened criminals in the back to offset the chance they'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOTGUN BELCHES flame.  Dudley goes down, shot in the back.  Exley drops the gun, raises his hands over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding in a convertible, waving to the crowds is the Grand Marshal -- the new Vice President, a young Richard Nixon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A midnight assembly.  The Chief, D.A. Loew and several high ranking brass.  Their attention riveted THROUGH the one-way glass into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody, exhausted, Exley sits across from two INTERNAL AFFAIRS DETECTIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a lot of explaining to do, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Exley begins...

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION SCREEN
dialogues.text: Where we're informed that tonight's episode of "Badge of Honor" is:  "Dedicated to the memory of technical advisor Sergeant Jack Vincennes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ribbon is cut.  Eager motorists roll down the blacktop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald Reagan applauds as Jane Wyman plunges her hands into fresh sidewalk cement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brass exchange concerned looks and raied eyebrows as they watch Exley THROUGH the glass, his VOICE heard OVER the SPEAKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Flatnose Frisco loan shark and Cauliflowered Cleveland enforcer seen earlier at the Victory Motel return to L.A., ready to fill the vacuum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush-Hush is delivered.  The headline:  "Actor Reynolds in his Final Role:  Conductor of the Night Train to Slice City."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley stares across at the Internal Affairs Detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  That's the whole story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Exley looks to the gray-tinted wall mirror...

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Loew leans over, whispers to the Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press would have a field day with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) When in doubt, feed them a hero. In this case, we'll need more than one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabled L.A. Cop Dies Defending City from Organized Crime!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley in his dress blue uniform.  The Chief smiles, pins gold stars to his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Edmund Exley.  Chief of Detectives.  Los Angeles Police Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause.  Flashbulbs.  Lynn watches from the back as Exley runs a handshake gauntlet.  Finally, he spots her. She's returned to her natural brunette.  Looks even better.  Exley steps over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic smile) I tried to throw it all away and they give it back in spades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley walks Lynn out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bisbee, Arizona.  The air's good for pensioners and I know where everything is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, before I back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn gestures ahead.  They walk to her car.  She opens the back door.  Bud's in the back.  Braces on his legs, head sutured.  Jaw wired shut and tubes running in and out.  But his hands still look strong.  Bud forces a smile through the wires, tries to say something, but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the push.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley takes his hand.  Bud squeezes till both men wince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just did what you did.  No rank, no glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exley slips his Medal of Valor into Bud's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From me to you.  It'll mean something if it's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud takes it, turns away so Exley won't see the tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Exley steps back, Lynn closes the door.  PARTY noises drift from upstairs.  Exley looks to Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I ever could've been in the running?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some men get the world.  Others get ex-hookers and a trip to Arizona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Exley wishes he'd gotten the trip to Arizona. She kisses him on the cheek, gets in the CAR.  STARTS it. Exley looks back at Bud.  Bud presses his hands to the glass.  Exley touches his side, palms half the man's size.  Hands against hands. The car moves. A turn into traffic, a good-bye TOOT on the HORN.  Exley's all alone.  As he watches them go...
